column4: so any ideas, anyone know what program is used to setup the xorg configuration if i had just installed the ubuntu-desktop task or whatnot?
why do you assume such a thing exists?  It doesn't afaik
so when ubuntu is installed it just drops the user on the command line?  i expected that when not installing X, but i assume when X is installed it will be configured
no, it doesn't just drop you in the command line.  gdm starts by default.  Is that your question?
no, what window manager will you be using?
basically blackbox and a web browser, thats about all i'm looking for
install blackbox and xorg then
and gdm/kdm/xdm/whatever if you want to get X starting by default
xorg needs no configuration
hmm, because with no configuration it just pulls up a black scren, and i alt-f1 to get back to console
how are you running it?
thank you btw, getting somewhere usefull now i think :)
startx
check /var/log/Xorg.0.log
wait.  You setup a window manager right?
in ~/.xsession i have the blackbox command
right, so when you say "black screen" you are sure X is not running?
check /var/log/Xorg.0.log though you should copy your .xsession to .xinitrc just to be sure
switching to .xinitrc solved it,  i wonder is xsession an outdated filename from XF86 then?  xorg uses new convention . . . either way doesn't really matter glad it works now :)
.xsession gets used by session managers like gdm,kdm,xdm :)
personally, I just link them so they are the same file...
Anyway, if you install gdm/kdm/xdm you don't even need one since the blackblox package provides a system-wide one
